snippet: Too often, our dysfunctional health care system is failing to control high blood pressure.
abstract: Editorial observes that a new federal health analysis has found that 36 million adults in the United States have high blood pressure that is not being controlled even though 32 million of them get regular medical care and 30 million of them have health insurance; contends that the analysis is shocking evidence of how America's complicated, dysfunctional health care system cannot deliver recommended care to many patients who could benefit.
lead_paragraph: Too often, our dysfunctional health care system is failing to control high blood pressure.
